title:
Number of bound states of the Hamiltonian of a lattice two-boson system
  with interactions up to the next neighbouring sites
authors: Saidakhmat N. Lakaev, Shakhobiddin I. Khamidov, Mukhayyo O. Akhmadova
abstract:
We study the family $H_{\gamma \lambda \mu}(K)$, $K\in \mathbb{T}^2,$ of
discrete Schr\"odinger operators, associated to the Hamiltonian of a system of
two identical bosons on the two-dimen\-sional lattice $\mathbb{Z}^2,$
interacting through on one site, nearest-neighbour sites and
next-nearest-neighbour sites with interaction magnitudes $\gamma,\lambda$ and
$\mu,$ respectively. We prove there existence an important invariant subspace
of operator $H_{\gamma \lambda \mu}(0)$ such that the restriction of the
operator $H_{\gamma \lambda \mu}(0)$ on this subspace has at most two
eigenvalues lying both as below the essential spectrum as well as above it,
depending on the interaction magnitude $\lambda,\mu\in \mathbb{R}$ (only). We
also give a sharp lower bound for the number of eigenvalues of
$H_{\gamma\lambda\mu}(K)$.
